title: 110_hr67
content: The "Veterans Outreach Improvement Act of 2007" is aimed at enhancing outreach activities within the Department of Veterans Affairs by adding a new subchapter on outreach activities to Chapter 5 of title 38, United States Code. The Secretary of the Department of Veterans Affairs is required to establish procedures for coordinating outreach activities within the Department, including offices like the Office of Public Affairs and the Veterans Health Administration. Annual reviews of these procedures are mandated to ensure they meet the necessary requirements. The Secretary aims to improve outreach and assistance to veterans and their families by providing assistance to State and county veterans agencies for programs in areas with a high concentration of eligible individuals. The Secretary prioritizes State and county veteran agencies in areas with large veteran populations or experiencing growth. Contracts may be entered into for outreach services, with agencies required to submit a three-year plan for fund usage. The Secretary may grant funds to State or county veterans agencies for outreach activities and assistance with veterans' benefits claims. State agencies receiving grants can allocate funds to county agencies for outreach services to veterans. The Secretary provides grants to State or county veterans agencies for outreach services and benefits assistance. Agencies must submit applications with a three-year plan and program descriptions to meet outcome measures. The Secretary will offer guidance on annual measures and grant application procedures. The Secretary provides grants to State or county veterans agencies for outreach services and benefits assistance. Agencies must meet annual outcome measures, and if they fail to do so, they must submit a remediation plan for approval before receiving further grants. Grant funds cannot be used for administrative purposes or to subsidize salaries. The Secretary provides grants to State or county veterans agencies for outreach services and benefits assistance. Federal funds provided under the grant may not exceed 50% of the total cost of government activities and must be used to expand existing programs. Priority is given to agencies serving the largest veteran populations, and counties without agencies can establish one with a grant. The State veterans agency can use grants for outreach services in counties without a veterans agency. Funds not used in a state without agencies will be reallocated to states with county veterans agencies. Grants can also be used for education and training for government employees providing veterans outreach services. Sec. 563. Outreach activities: funding. Amounts for Department outreach activities shall be budgeted separately. The Secretary must include a separate statement of the requested appropriation for a specific account in materials submitted to Congress in support of the Department budget. "Outreach" is defined as providing information and services to veterans and their survivors. Authorization of appropriations is granted to the Secretary. The Secretary is authorized to appropriate $25,000,000 for fiscal years 2008, 2009, and 2010 for grants under section 562(d) of this title. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in the chapter. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is required to implement outreach activities within 120 days of the enactment of the Act. This includes coordinating activities within the Department, cooperative activities with States, grants for outreach improvement, funding, and defining outreach. Authorization of appropriations is also included.
